realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Grab the straight mid-shaft with a full-hand grasp, keep the hooked handle pointing backward, and let the folded canopy act as the weighted head while performing full chopping swings
realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Lay the brush bristles upward on the desk; strike downward so the canopy buries into the bristle field.
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: Use axe to chop the firewood log. Users might feel increased tension until a sudden satisfying release occurs, as well as noticeable penetration distance.
realism.explanation: Dense bristles create an initial firmness followed by gradual penetration, giving a mild analogue to cutting into fibers. Still missing the decisive crack but offers more credible depth and resistance than most objects.

realism.physicalContactObject: folded checkered umbrella with hooked handle
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Grab the straight mid-shaft with a full-hand grasp, keep the hooked handle pointing backward, and let the folded canopy act as the weighted head while performing full chopping swings
realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Stand directly in front of one seat cushion; use the flat top of the cushion as the chopping surface and swing the umbrella straight down onto it.
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: Use axe to chop the firewood log. Users might feel increased tension until a sudden satisfying release occurs, as well as noticeable penetration distance.
realism.explanation: Thick cushion provides substantial resistance then compression, permitting a deeper ‘sink’ like embedding the axe head. Absent is the audible crack and rebound of wood, but the macro-scale motion feels closer than with desk items.

realism.physicalContactObject: folded checkered umbrella with hooked handle
